meanings.definition: Relating to or caused by heart disease.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with cardiogenic heart disease.
meanings.sent2: The cardiogenic symptoms were evident during the medical examination.
meanings.sent3: The cardiogenic condition made the patient's heart beat irregularly.
meanings.sent4: Her cardiogenic issues were like a storm brewing in her chest.
meanings.sent5: The cardiogenic problem was as serious as a heart attack.

meanings.sent1: The cardiogenic pain felt like it was coming directly from the heart.
meanings.sent2: The cardiogenic rhythm of the heart was irregular.
meanings.sent3: His cardiogenic heartbeat was like a drum playing in his chest.
meanings.sent4: The cardiogenic source of the pain was a mystery to the doctors.
meanings.sent5: The cardiogenic origin of the problem was clear from the test results.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the heart's ability to pump blood.
meanings.sent1: The cardiogenic function of the heart was weakened.
meanings.sent2: The cardiogenic capacity of the heart was measured during the stress test.
meanings.sent3: Her cardiogenic performance on the treadmill test surprised the doctors.
meanings.sent4: The cardiogenic power of the heart was crucial for circulation.
meanings.sent5: The cardiogenic efficiency of the heart determined the patient's health status.
